# External ressources worth to look at 

## Similar apps

- **Microreact:** It uses a "Data Contract" (CSV + Newick tree) - Learn from their CSV structure. #TODO - 

- **Dash Bio:** (unknown to me) Great for specific plots (Volcano, Manhattan) but lacks the easy multi-page layout of Shiny. #TODO

- **Galaxy Interactive Tools (GxIT):** Most existing GxITs use R/Shiny. By using **Shiny for Python**, you are at the cutting edge of the Galaxy ecosystem. #TODO


## Videos 

- [Shiny for Python: Building Interactive Dashboards](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=InyYw5Ii14U) : practical walkthrough of how to structure a Shiny for Python application and understanding the "Visualization Layer"
